oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ft. Pillow stationery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lined stationery from Ft. Pillow, Tenn. Imprinted with the seal of the Confederate States of America, including a likeness of President Jefferson Davis, and the words, "Men of the South? A free-born race, They vouch a patriot line; Ready the foeman's van to face, And guard their country's shrine; By sire and son a haloing light Through time is borne along; They 'nothing ask but what is right, And yeild to nothing wrong.'"
